00.orig_text: Internal emails expose Boeing-Air Force contract discussions
00.text: Internal emails expose Boeing-Air Force contract discussions

02.orig_text: Emails exchanged among United States Air Force officials regarding a USD$23 billion dollar deal with aircraft manufacturer Boeing have been entered into the public record.
02.text: Emails exchanged among United States Air Force officials regarding a USD$23 billion dollar deal with aircraft manufacturer Boeing have been entered into the public record.

03.orig_text: Senator John McCain (R-AZ) entered them into the Congressional Record during a speech last week against the now-cancelled deal to lease 100 mid-air tanker aircraft from Boeing.
03.text: Senator John McCain (R-AZ) entered them into the Congressional Record during a speech last week against the now-cancelled deal to lease 100 mid-air tanker aircraft from Boeing.

04.orig_text: Congressional lawmakers rejected the proposal in October, although industry experts say the deal had been killed by the Pentagon because of reports stating that the deal had favored Boeing.
04.text: Congressional lawmakers rejected the proposal in October, although industry experts say the deal had been killed by the Pentagon because of reports stating that the deal had favored Boeing.

05.orig_text: Senator McCain has been the deal's most vocal critic.
05.text: Senator McCain has been the deal's most vocal critic.

06.orig_text: The original negotiations with Boeing were over a no-bid contract.
06.text: The original negotiations with Boeing were over a no-bid contract.

07.orig_text: Such contracts are often justified by the speed they offer, eliminating a preliminary bid and selection round that may last months.
07.text: Such contracts are often justified by the speed they offer, eliminating a preliminary bid and selection round that may last months.

08.orig_text: However, no-bid contracts are only open to the company selected by the procuring agency.
08.text: However, no-bid contracts are only open to the company selected by the procuring agency.

09.orig_text: This leaves no-bid contracts open to accusations of conflicts of interest among the procurement personnel.
09.text: This leaves no-bid contracts open to accusations of conflicts of interest among the procurement personnel.

10.orig_text: Such accusations have previously been leveled against Vice President Dick Cheney for a no-bid contract to Halliburton, and are now being made against senior Air Force officials for choosing Boeing to replace its tanker fleet.
10.text: Such accusations have previously been leveled against Vice President Dick Cheney for a no-bid contract to Halliburton, and are now being made against senior Air Force officials for choosing Boeing to replace its tanker fleet.

11.orig_text: In the released emails, Air Force officials responsible for the awarding of contracts appear biased against Boeing's main competitor, Airbus and its CEO Ralph Crosby.
11.text: In the released emails, Air Force officials responsible for the awarding of contracts appear biased against Boeing's main competitor, Airbus and its CEO Ralph Crosby.

12.orig_text: Airbus is owned by European Aeronautic Defense & Space Company (EADS).
12.text: Airbus is owned by European Aeronautic Defense & Space Company (EADS).

13.orig_text: Airbus manufacturers a number of passenger and military aircraft and has gained market share in passenger aircraft over Boeing in recent years.
13.text: Airbus manufacturers a number of passenger and military aircraft and has gained market share in passenger aircraft over Boeing in recent years.

14.orig_text: The following is a sequential email exchange regarding Airbus as recorded in the Congressional Record: :Special Asst. to the Secretary and Director of Air Force Communications Bill Bodie: ``We don't have to turn the other cheek, you know.
14.text: The following is a sequential email exchange regarding Airbus as recorded in the Congressional Record: :Special Asst. to the Secretary and Director of Air Force Communications Bill Bodie: ``We don't have to turn the other cheek, you know.

15.orig_text: I'm ready to tell the truth about Airbus's boom, footprint, and financial shortcoming.
15.text: I'm ready to tell the truth about Airbus's boom, footprint, and financial shortcoming.

16.orig_text: But maybe we should sleep on it.``
16.text: But maybe we should sleep on it.``

17.orig_text: :Secretary of the Air Force James Roche: ``No, Sir, save it and blow him away.
17.text: :Secretary of the Air Force James Roche: ``No, Sir, save it and blow him away.

18.orig_text: He admits that they were not technically qualified!
18.text: He admits that they were not technically qualified!

19.orig_text: And, we keep their record of bribes as our trump card!
19.text: And, we keep their record of bribes as our trump card!

21.orig_text: :Civilian Deputy Undersecretary of the Air Force for Acquisition Darleen Druyun: ``I read with disgust the article on Airbus tankers from the new EADS CEO of North America.
21.text: :Civilian Deputy Undersecretary of the Air Force for Acquisition Darleen Druyun: ``I read with disgust the article on Airbus tankers from the new EADS CEO of North America.

22.orig_text: What BS ... should not have been surprised at the slime ... his day of reckoning will come hopefully.``
22.text: What BS ... should not have been surprised at the slime ... his day of reckoning will come hopefully.``

23.orig_text: :Secretary of the Air Force James Roche: ``Oy.
23.text: :Secretary of the Air Force James Roche: ``Oy.

25.orig_text: I had hoped you would have stayed and tortured him slowly over the next few years until EADS got rid of him!
25.text: I had hoped you would have stayed and tortured him slowly over the next few years until EADS got rid of him!

27.orig_text: An email from Burkhardt & Associates to James Roche advises the Secretary to release fiscal numbers favorable to Boeing, apparently regardless of the facts: ``I'd distribute a one page memo saying the per plane cost of the lease will not be greater than x and have x be less than the last lease Boeing did for some commercial entity--or that x is y dollars less than the cost of a new tanker,`` it said.
27.text: An email from Burkhardt & Associates to James Roche advises the Secretary to release fiscal numbers favorable to Boeing, apparently regardless of the facts: ``I'd distribute a one page memo saying the per plane cost of the lease will not be greater than x and have x be less than the last lease Boeing did for some commercial entity--or that x is y dollars less than the cost of a new tanker,`` it said.

28.orig_text: An additional email by Roche provides a stark contrast to his criticism of Airbus, as he talks to Assistant Secretary of the Air Force for Acquisition Marvin Sambur about Boeing, saying, ``I love Ya, Big Guy.
28.text: An additional email by Roche provides a stark contrast to his criticism of Airbus, as he talks to Assistant Secretary of the Air Force for Acquisition Marvin Sambur about Boeing, saying, ``I love Ya, Big Guy.

29.orig_text: Give it to the Blue Eyed Arabs of the North (the expression we used for Boeing).``
29.text: Give it to the Blue Eyed Arabs of the North (the expression we used for Boeing).``

30.orig_text: GovExec.com quotes a ``Senate aide`` as saying: ``The House language [of the spending bill] ignores an analysis of alternatives called for in last year's authorizing language and by Pentagon Acquisition Director Michael Wynne and the DSB.
30.text: GovExec.com quotes a ``Senate aide`` as saying: ``The House language [of the spending bill] ignores an analysis of alternatives called for in last year's authorizing language and by Pentagon Acquisition Director Michael Wynne and the DSB.

31.orig_text: It precludes such an analysis and predetermines the outcome in favor of the Boeing 767 before the study is even initiated.``
31.text: It precludes such an analysis and predetermines the outcome in favor of the Boeing 767 before the study is even initiated.``

32.orig_text: The activist organization the Project on Government Oversight has called it ``a textbook case of favoritism to a single defense contractor.``
32.text: The activist organization the Project on Government Oversight has called it ``a textbook case of favoritism to a single defense contractor.``

33.orig_text: Assistant Secretary of the Air Force for Acquisition Marvin Sambur defended the Air Force's exclusive consideration of Boeing, saying, ``This was not a competitive bid process.
33.text: Assistant Secretary of the Air Force for Acquisition Marvin Sambur defended the Air Force's exclusive consideration of Boeing, saying, ``This was not a competitive bid process.

34.orig_text: The Air Force was ordered by Congress to work with Boeing on the new tanker program.``
34.text: The Air Force was ordered by Congress to work with Boeing on the new tanker program.``

35.orig_text: Boeing had previously hired Civilian Deputy Undersecretary of the Air Force for Acquisition Darleen Druyun.
35.text: Boeing had previously hired Civilian Deputy Undersecretary of the Air Force for Acquisition Darleen Druyun.

36.orig_text: This caused a controversy over conflict of interest and led to felony charges against Boeing Chief Financial Officer Michael Sears for illegally hiring her.
36.text: This caused a controversy over conflict of interest and led to felony charges against Boeing Chief Financial Officer Michael Sears for illegally hiring her.

37.orig_text: Former military personnel are often hired by defense contractors to lobby for contracts.
37.text: Former military personnel are often hired by defense contractors to lobby for contracts.

38.orig_text: Days after Sen. McCain's remarks, the Air Force said the tanker replacement contract would be revived as an open bid.
38.text: Days after Sen. McCain's remarks, the Air Force said the tanker replacement contract would be revived as an open bid.

39.orig_text: Deputy Defense Secretary Wolfowitz published an open-article in the Congressional Record, saying: ``After we have selected an appropriate alternative, we intend to require competition.``
39.text: Deputy Defense Secretary Wolfowitz published an open-article in the Congressional Record, saying: ``After we have selected an appropriate alternative, we intend to require competition.``
